title: Surely naming-and-shaming someone for having an inappropriate name isn't against ToS...

replies.body: Naming and shaming is naming and shaming, regardless of the situation. It's against the rules with no exceptions. While it *might* not make sense that someone who has an inappropriate summoner name be "protected" by the no name and shame policy, it's still important to consider that "naming and shaming" is never an appropriate way to deal with troublesome players.

Ever heard of a slippery slope? I believe that's why. When you create rules it's important to be absolute in how you deal with them regardless of the situation so that you can prevent plotholes or hypocrisy in your own methods. Sure, this username no longer exists, but it still applies.
The naming and shaming policy is a load of crap it shouldn't exist

i mean i think it just applies no matter what

i made a post parodying a guy from about a month ago, where i joked about 'statpadding' with a picture of my summoner in the screenshot. 
that post got removed for naming and shaming
